intro: Epilobium latifolium f. munzii, commonly known as the broadleaf willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a perennial herb characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, streambanks, and woodland edges. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This subspecies is native to western North America and is often found in regions with temperate climates.
